snippet: Hundreds of students protesting a planned 6 percent tuition increase tried to force their way into the Parliament building during a speech by the finance minister.
abstract: Cape Town police block student demonstrators from entering Parliament building, during latest in series of protests over economic and racial issues at South African universities.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of students protesting a planned 6 percent tuition increase tried to force their way into the Parliament building during a speech by the finance minister.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; South Africa: Students and Police Clash
headline.main: South African Students Clash With Police in Cape Town Over Tuition
